intro: Nannoglottis qinghaiensis, commonly known as the Qinghai nannoglottis, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai region of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive, pungent odor. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
